messages.message: Are we considering grid style for prosumer where one can use their phone or tablet?

my understanding is that we’re not building for phone/tablet screens for the May 1 launch

cc @Jessica
That is correct - you should see that it's not too bad down to 800px width or so they'll work for most tablets, but definitely not mobile. We'd need almost completely new designs to support that.
Might be worth us giving a “for the best experience use AI Hub on a tablet, laptop or desktop computer” when we detect the viewport width is too small
I would like for us to consider a mobile element as some may want to take a photo of their daughters homework on their own kitchen table and have it solve it.... :slightly_smiling_face:
Mobile element would be extremly powerful at UBS with their FA in the clients homes and sincle iphone and android can handle the upload doc as a photo it makes a simple demo

I do agree Josh. The ‘consumer’ part of pro-sumer expects mobile compatibility as table stakes. 

When we do a lot of marketing for the launch, most people will click-through from articles on their mobile and it would be great if we can give them a good experience
ChatGPT and DALLE-2 both had mobile-compatible web-apps at launch

Another issue beyond screen size is that the current AI Hub UI is designed for mouse and keyboard, and some interactions do not translate well to touch

We’d need to redesign a lot of features before promising mobile compatibility
I think we should consider it platform wide versus kicking the can down the road to be honest
it’s a matter of prioritization since we only have 2 days before our internal code cut for the external release @Kerry
Ack, i'll discuss this with Anant and Clemens.
